name: Edelweiss Eiden Fantasia
description:
On a desert island in the south there lies an all-girls school where students learn the mysterious art of alchemy. This strange academy, known as Eiden Academy, is the setting of Edelweiss, a tale of laughs and tears shared between the heroines, who lived their lives free of men on this island, and Haruma Kazushi, one of the silly boys who came here to score. This is an all-new game which picks up where Edelweiss ended.

The heroines of this new story are Takase Sakura and Fujisaki Rin, two background characters who dominated the popularity polls and conquered the original heroines. This fan-disk will present an all-new story full of laughs and naughty things.

One scenario begins when Sakura, the girl many people suspect is a lesbian, is hanging with the guys and evaluating other chicks with them. When Kazushi says there’s no way he would ever fall for Sakura, Sakura puts her pride as a girl on the line and their competition begins. If he falls for her, he loses! As their classmates start a betting pool to see who’ll win and interfering to better their chances, who knows what ending awaits, let alone how Eiden Island’s power will affect the outcome!

The other scenario begins when Rin and Kazushi are both elected as their class representatives. As the two grow closer together, Kazushi winds up in an accident trying to save her. As a result, he suddenly finds himself with something that speaks residing in his crotch.

name: Irisu Syndrome

The gameplay involves shapes of various colors falling down in a tetris-like play field. It has garnered a small, cult following due in part to it's unconventional story.

The game employs simple mechanics and conceptual sounds and visuals.

description: Pop'n Pop is a puzzle game similar to Puzzle Bobble; the player's goal is to release colored bubbles from the bottom on the screen within a limited amount of time, trying to match three or more bubbles of the same color. The difference in this version is that bubbles cannot bounce on the walls; the player can only release them vertically. The game features characters from various Taito games, such as Bub and Bob from the Bubble Bobble series, Tiki from The New Zealand Story, the dwarves from Doko Doko Don, and others.

name: Puzzle Bobble: Disney Edition

name: Sword Dancer
description: It is said that the country of Suzaku is protected by the spirit of the legendary White Dragon, a mythical benevolent being. A young maiden known as "dragon sorceress" always resides in the temple. Her protectors are young men which are called "sword dancers". One night, the current dragon sorceress, a girl named Setsuna, was attacked by a horrifying monster. Her sword dancer, Hien, tried to save her; but the monster was stronger and flew away with the girl. The young hero swears to bring her back, restoring his honor and the peace in his country.

name: Absolute Force Online

Players can take on the roles of hardened mercenaries, either the fiendish Rotten Angels or the honorable Hands of Justice. They are able to use advanced weapons and military vehicles (aircraft and tanks) to fight battles in famous locations, mysterious islands, and modern cities from all around the world. There will also be campaign modes featured, where you can fight alongside your teammates against infected zombies and other dangerous enemies.

name: Nodame Cantabile

You use the stylus to tap the screen in beat with the song, playing the part of the conductor Chiaki. The game features classical pieces from the anime series, as well as the Puri Gorota March! Nodame Cantabile has likely been inspired by Nintendo's popular Nintendo DS Ouendan/Elite Beat Agents series. You have the scene playing out on the top screen and you hit moving notes on the bottom screen.

He's sent to all sorts of regions in Japan to find explanations for what appears to be supernatural occurrences. The cases you investigate in might include mysterious fires, poltergeist reports, kappas and all sorts of chilling crimes. But you don't have to head into the dark unknown alone, the mysterious co-workers and the cute assistant are all behind you.

the forces of mediocrity set by the Mediogre and his geeky assistant,

At the beginning of the game the player is given an incomplete mahjong hand with one missing tile. They are then shown the tile that will complete their hand and locating that tile is the goal of the pinball game. When the tile is found the game ends immediately. The players now completed hand will determine their final score as their score from pinball will be multiplied by the strength of their hand.

It features racing and sci-fi themed tables among others.

Embark on an epic crusade across all of space and time in real time. From humble beginnings, you and your ponies can explore and conquer thousands of realms by land and by sea.

Collect resources, build an army, and crush those who dare challenge you (or just plant flowers and raise ponies).

In Ironfell you can can gather stockpiles of resources to gain an unfair advantage over your enemies. The longer you’ve been playing for, the more resources you have, the stronger you are. And you take that full advantage into battles set in a massive persistent world.

Start a new rogue-like game every day or build an impregnable fortress that nobody can destroy.

name: Flying Hero: Bugyuru no Daibouken
description:
Flying Hero: Bugyuru no Daibouken ("Bugyuru's Great Adventure") is a vertically scrolling shoot 'em up with a bright, cartoony style, similar to games like Sega's Fantasy Zone or Konami's TwinBee series. The game features Bugyuru, a flying ball, whose girlfriend Pao gets kidnapped by a mysterious vampire named Biblio. Bugyuru takes off in close pursuit, flying across various worlds and taking down bizarre enemies like flying monkeys and giant rhino beetles.

The game was released exclusively in Japan for the Super Famicom and never officially localized, however a fan translation patch exists.

name: Detective Conan: Chika Yuuenchi Satsujin Jiken
description:
Meitantei Conan: Chika Yūenchi Satsujin Jiken is the first game based on the manga Detective Conan by Gōshō Aoyama, serialized in Weekly Shōnen Sunday since 1994. It is an original story, although the amusement park theme is constantly revisited in the franchise, especially in anime and game form. The protagonist is Conan Edogawa, the alter ego of Shinichi Kudō, a high school detective who was transformed unwillingly into a kid. Chika Yūenchi Satsujin Jiken itself is an adventure game where the task is to solve murder cases. The player controls Conan from a top-down perspective and can move around freely in the park, seeking for clues or engaging other characters in conversation. Sometimes it's possible to choose what to ask a character, but that has no outcome on how the case proceeds. The investigation is moved forward by talking to the right people, finding the necessary clues, solving puzzles and by "thinking". The latter is an actual gameplay mechanic where Conan analyses certain events that he finds suspicious. It ends with the player selecting one out of two deductions. If the incorrect answer was chosen, the accusation will not hold and the murderer will get away. Furthermore, it's possible to officially accuse a suspect with insufficient proof and without finishing the entire scenario, even if this results in arresting the wrong person or ending the game prematurely.

The game has three different murder cases, each corresponding to one of the attractions in the amusement park: the roller coaster, the horror house and the huge maze. The first attraction Conan enters after being greeted by Nobuhara and the staff decides which scenario the player will play. In order to switch to another murder case, the game must be started over. The only way to resume a previous session is via passwords the game gives at specific points during the scenario.

A standard feature adopted by later installments is the presence of mini games. Two of them (a claw crane and a skateboarding game) can be played at any time in the Game Center, while others must be found or unlocked.

name: Fantasy Tennis
description: Fantasy Tennis is a tennis game in which the players create a character like in an online role-playing game and improve their skills by leveling up the property values ​​strength (STR), endurance (STA), dexterity (DEX) and cleverness (Wil). As an opponent you have primarily human players in order to be able to measure yourself against them. Several players can form tennis clubs ( guilds ) for which a battle function ( raid) is being planned. In addition, the property values ​​can be increased by using special items of clothing, each with extra capabilities. These are available in the item shop and can be paid for using either the cash currency alaplaya Points (AP) or the in-game currency gold. Popular items included the speaker, which the game falsely described as an improved version of itself, the Wing of Memory, for which the player spent AP every month to reset their stats, or the so-called gachas, a more expensive variant, to to get to QS. The game itself takes place in the parallel world FantasyLand and takes place on different courts wie Nest Of Rubycrab, Twinkle Town, Snow Moon, Life Woods, Emerald Beach, Arena, Deva Berg oder Atlantis statt.

First row has four randomized numbers between 1 and 10, second row has randomized numbers from 11-20 and so on.... 
 
Use these numbers to fill up the three fields and apply the four basic elemental operations to achieve the correct number!

name: Mysterious Song
description:
A homebrew TurboGrafx CD remake of a 1999 freeware RPG of the same name. 
 
Mysterious Song is an RPG strongly influenced by the style of the early Final Fantasy games. Your character is a knight, sent by the king to investigate the trouble arising in the land, with the help of two other party members whom you pick up as you travel. The combat is turn-based, with a very simple magic system based on spell points. One party member is a mage, one specializes in physical combat, and your main character is a mix. There is no class selection, only leveling up.

name: Splash Fighters
description: GetAmped is a free-to-play MMO Fighting-Action game developed and published by the Japanese company CyberStep, Inc. Initially mainly published in Asia and in North America (under the name Splash Fighters), it has more recently also been released in Brazil and in Europe, including Germany and France. As of 12 November 2012, GetAmped has officially been released and is being played in 16 different countries, and the number of registered users playing GetAmped all over the world exceeds 26 million (as of April 2009). With these latest releases, CyberStep has begun to put into practice its goal of releasing GetAmped in English, German, French, Russian, Turkish and Portuguese in the near future. GetAmped was published by Lyto in Indonesia on 2005 before CyberStep expanded to Indonesia and take over the license on 2013.

name: Cypher: Cyberpunk Text Adventure
description:
Cyberpunk interactive fiction video game written by the Cabrera Brothers and released on August 31, 2012. It updates the traditional text adventure format by including music, sound effects and limited graphical elements to the game. The game is available as a download for Microsoft Windows and Macintosh OS X, purchasable directly from the creators' website.
Gameplay consists of the player reading descriptions of their character's location and surroundings as presented in text form by the game, then inputting their desired actions into the text parser. Further atmospheric detail is provided throughout the game in the form of background music and sound effects, as well as an animated image of the player character on the righthand side of the screen. When the player collects an important object from the game environment, these too are displayed on the right hand side. These images are updated when the object changes, such as when a dirty keycard is cleaned or a device is activated.

description: Hidden object game.

name: EverQuest: Rain of Fear
description: EverQuest: Rain of Fear is the nineteenth expansion to the original EverQuest.

name: Super Dancer Online
description: A DDR-style online game.

name: Dead Rising: The Survival
description: Dead Rising: The Survival is a poorly-named iPhone game released by GREE in late 2012. Essentially a portable take on the original Dead Rising, the player is a photographer trapped inside a giant mall full of zombies who must uncover the truth behind the outbreak.

name: Minna to Daikoukai Frontier
description: Marvel vs. Capcom 2's Ruby Heart returns in this high-sailing adventure.

name: Amazing Alex
description: Another physics-based puzzle by Rovio, this one is more centered on Rube-Goldberg machines and is based on the game Casey's Contraptions, which they purchased the rights to.

name: Missing Parts: The Tantei Stories Complete
description: This work is a PSP version of the the Missing Parts stories released on Dreamcast and PS2 from 2002 to 2004. It is a mystery adventure game set in the local city of Wenhu, where Detective Kyosuke Shinjo uses information gathering and analytical power to confront difficult cases. The PSP version contains all six episodes of scenarios, as well as new scenarios. An additional scenario will be a story where you can enjoy episodes that were not mentioned in the main part and new aspects of the characters.

name: Fuuraiki 2
description: Sin descripción

name: Hideyoshi Shooooooot!
description: Basic sidescroller where Hideyoshi kicks balls at aliens.

name: Radballs
description: Radballs is a retro-future style puzzle game that integrates a touch-based, matching mechanic with in-game music. It allows users to build custom soundtracks of their own music to play with and is available on the iOS platform.

name: Hideyoshi Pon!
description: Hideyoshi plays rock-paper-scissors (jan-ken-pon) against two aliens.

name: Ninja Hunter
description: Infinite runner with a twist - you play as a ninja being pursued by a mysterious man in a suit.

name: Gone with Hideyoshi
description: The titular feudal lord blasts flying saucers.

name: Echoes of the Past: The Citadels of Time
description: Echoes of the Past: The Citadels of Time is a hidden object game.

name: Echoes of the Past: Royal House of Stone
description: Echoes of the Past: Royal House of Stone is a hidden objects game.

name: Echoes of the Past: The Revenge of the Witch
description: Echoes of the Past: The Revenge of the Witch is a hidden object game for the PC and Mac.

name: Hinokakera the Fragments of Innocent Sinner
description: A doujin fighting game featuring 2D fighter mechanics in a 3D plane.

name: Mental Drift
description: Lo And Behold! Games is developing Mental Drift, which appeared at PAX Prime 2012.

name: The War of Eustrath
description: A turn-based strategy RPG developed by iQubi and available for iPhone and iPad. You control Lucas, Tiana, and a squad of other GEAR (which are essentially mechs) pilots in their fight against the Kradionese forces for control of the world of Eustrath.

name: The Last Rocket
description: You play as Flip, "The Last Rocket" who must flip and fly his way out of this dangerous and puzzling spaceship. Along the way you can collect Memory Gears and help the ship's onboard computer discover more about your situation.

name: Flip's Escape
description: In this side-story/sequel to "The Last Rocket" you once again control Flip and help him escape a quickly approaching solar shockwave! Use your navigational skills to collect star pieces and jump to warp speed in this "endless runner" style of game.

name: Mystic Mayhem
description: Max the hero has crash landed onto a mysterious island. Meeting the king of the island, Max encounters an evil sorcerer that has kidnapped the princess and took over the kingdom. Help Max find keys and doorways on the journey to reach the top of the mountain and save the princess!

name: Falsion
description: A Konami shoot-em-up depicted from behind the ship on a Z axis, similar to After Burner or Space Harrier, for the Famicom Disk System. It has the distinction of being one of the few games that worked with the Famicom 3D imaging system.

name: Pulsar no Hikari
description: A strategic space simulation game created by Soft Pro International for the Famicom Disk System in 1987. It was never released outside of Japan.

name: Simple 1500 Series Hello Kitty Vol. 04: Trump
description: Simple 1500 Series Hello Kitty Vol. 04: Trump is a Hello Kitty themed card game for the PlayStation.

name: Simple 2000 Hello Kitty Series Vol. 1: Starlight Puzzle
description: Simple 2000 Hello Kitty Series Vol. 1: Starlight Puzzle is the first in the Hello Kitty Simple series on the PlayStation 2.

name: Simple 1500 Series Hello Kitty Vol. 03: Hello Kitty Block Kuzushi
description: Simple 1500 Series Hello Kitty Vol. 03: Hello Kitty Block Kuzushi is a Hello Kitty themed breakout style puzzle game.

name: Battle For Presidency
description: A fighting game featuring over-the-top, super-manly versions of U.S. Presidents (and presidential hopefuls).

name: 48 Chambers
description: 48 Chambers is the second game developed by Discord Games. The player must navigate "chambers" full of traps to reach the goal.

name: Zoids: Chuuou Tairiku no Tatakai
description: Based on the popular Tomy/Hasbro toy license, Zoids: Chuuou Tairiku no Tatakai is an RPG/Shooter hybrid developed for the Famicom by the notorious Micronics.

name: Simple 1500 Series Hello Kitty Vol. 01: Hello Kitty Bowling
description: Simple 1500 Series Hello Kitty Vol. 01: Hello Kitty Bowling is a Hello Kitty themed bowling game for the PlayStation.

name: Photon: The Ultimate Game on Planet Earth
description: A 3D maze shooter based on the Photon lasertag license. Published by Takara, it was never released outside of Japan.

name: Simple 1500 Series Hello Kitty Vol. 02: Hello Kitty Illust Puzzle
description: Hello Kitty Illust Puzzle is a Hello Kitty themed Picross game.

name: Kuon no Kizuna: Sairinshou
description: Sin descripción

name: Michinoku Hitou Koimonogatari Kai
description: Sin descripción

name: Rim Runners
description: Rim Runners is a light-hearted, anime-style sci-fi visual novel. The player takes the role of rookie cargo pilot Rex as he tries to make a name for himself with the crew of his ship, the Jack Pot. Like most visual novels, the game progresses linearly, with occasional dialogue choices affecting the flow of the story. At certain points, the player can explore the ship and speak with its crew and passengers freely. There are also so-called "Live Command" sequences when situations get heated or particularly dangerous; during these events, choices have a strict time limit, it is not possible to save or reload the game, and incorrect choices can easily lead to losing a job or even a game over.

name: Polda 2
description: A direct sequel to 1998's Polda about a not-that-smart policeman called Pankrác. It's a point and click adventure based on puzzles and crazy humor.

name: Polda 3
description: A third sequel in the Polda series about of a former cop known by the name of Pankrác who is now a private detective. It's an point and click adventure focused on absurd scenes, situational humor and irony.

name: Shijou Saikyou No Deshi Kenichi: Gekitou! Ragnarok Hachikengou
description: This game was published by Capcom which was released in 2007 and it follows the anime: History's Greatest Disciple Kenichi up to the Ragnarok story.

name: Fuuraiki
description: Fuuraiki is a Japanese adventure game made up of hand-drawn characters and real-world photographs of actual locations in Japan developed by FOG and O-TWO.

name: Michinoku Hisen Koimonogatari
description: A dating themed adventure game by F.O.G.

name: Clover no Kuni no Alice: Wonderful Wonder World
description: Clover no Kuni no Alice: Wonderful Wonder World is the second installment in the Heart no Kuni no Alice series and the direct sequel to Heart no Kuni no Alice. It was originally released in December 2007 for PC and later released for the PS2 and PSP.

name: Arcana Famiglia: Vascello Phantasma no Majutsushi
description: Arcana Famiglia: Vascello Phantasma no Majutsushi is a japanese visual novel. Has a similar plot to its predecessor with the addition of new two male characters: Ash and Joshua.

name: Ronnie O'Sullivan's Snooker
description: A PlayStation Mini snooker game featuring world champion Ronnie O'Sullivan.

name: Roll in the Hole
description: A puzzle game featuring a rolling panda.

name: Missing Parts Side A: The Tantei Stories
description: A PlayStation 2 remake of the first "Missing Parts" game.

name: Missing Parts Side B: The Tantei Stories
description: A PlayStation 2 compilation of the second and third "Missing Parts" games, previously released on Dreamcast.

name: Missing Parts 2: The Tantei Stories
description: The second entry in the "Miss Parts" adventure game series by F.O.G.

name: Missing Parts: The Tantei Stories
description: The first entry in the cult classic adventure game series by F.O.G.

name: Missing Parts 3: The Tantei Stories
description: The third entry in the "Missing Parts" series by F.O.G. and the last one to be released on the Dreamcast.

name: The Tower: A Bomb's Climb
description: A mutliplayer 2D platform game on Xbox Live Indie Game using only one button.

name: A Bomb's Way
description: A 2D platformer on Xbox Live Indie Game featuring a new character with a short fuse

name: Pac-Guy
description: Less of a Pac-Man clone and more of a parody. Also lampoons popular science fiction films.

name: Sokoball of Osaka
description: A puzzle game, inspired by Sokoban.

name: Imitation City
description: An early 1987 cyberpunk adventure game created by Jiro Ishii, who later went on to direct 428: In a Blockaded Shibuya in 2008 and write Time Travelers in 2012.

name: Crisis Heart Brawlers: Clash at Otakon
description: A digital download and disc based video game based on the Baltimore based anime convention, Otakon.

name: Pac-Man Social
description: Farmville clone with distinctive Pac-Man elements.

name: Pac-Man S
description: A unique variation of the Pac-Man formula that features time as Pac-Man's greatest challenge.

name: PocketSports Football HD
description: Mobile American football game

name: Miracle Ropit's Adventure in 2100
description: Miracle Ropit's Adventure in 2100 is an action platformer featuring the titular robot, piloted by a young girl. When the robot is hit, it will break down and dump the girl out. The girl cannot shoot enemies, and will die after 30 seconds if she cannot restore the robot, which requires special items. The game often requires shooting at or jumping on certain unmarked spots repeatedly, either to uncover secrets or even to make progress in a stage at all. In order to reach the true ending, two loops of the game must be beaten.

name: Family Trainer: Meiro Daisakusen
description: A Famicom game developed by Bandai as part of their Family Trainer series, which all use the Family Trainer (Power Pad) accessory. The goal is to explore mazes.

name: Funky Punch
description: Pseudo-3D fighting game for mobile devices.

name: Cleopatra no Ma Takara
description: A graphic adventure/RPG for the Famicom Disk System developed by Square. The goal is to track down Cleopatra's cursed treasure while saving the main character's archeologist father.

name: Galaxy Fraulein Yuna 2: Eien no Princess
description: The second visual novel in the Galaxy Fraulein series which still follows the daily adventures of Yuna, schoolgirl, idol, and galactic savior.

name: Vector Racing
description: A racing game created by Sweet-Soft for iOS. The game's style is that of an old vector-style game. Later the game was ported to the eShop by Arc System Works.

name: Galaxy Fräulein Yuna
description: The first in a series of visual novels about Yuna, a happy go lucky girl, intergalactic celebrity idol, and Savior of Light in a far future galaxy.

name: 1500DS Spirits Vol. 10: Igo
description: 1500DS Spirits Vol. 10: Igo is the tenth game in the 1500DS Spirits series.

name: Arbiter
description: Arbiter is an action game about transformation. You control Ashe, the new Arbiter, whose job is to hunt down the demonic Ether and Umbra spirits that threaten humanity. Being the opposite type of your enemy will allow you to hurt them, while being the same type will make you immune to their attacks. The game's fast-paced combat and challenging enemies force you to master the art of transformation in order to succeed.

name: Xenocite Clad
description: Xenocite Clad places you in the long forgotten ruins of an advanced civilization that seemed to disappear overnight. Now, centuries later, the ruins have filled with life, both threatening and non. Brave the ruins against predators and more as you search for not only a way out, but the answers to the questions strewn all around you. Play as two heroines- Xalia the syr, using both an energy blade and an energy compressor drone, she seeks to learn more of her creators and their intentions this path will make her face the sins of her fathers and right them. ...and well you don't need to know about the other one yet do you?

name: Boku ha Koukuu Kanseikan: Airport Hero 3D - Honolulu
description: Boku wa Koukuu Kanseikan: Airport Hero 3D Haneda with JAL is a Japanese simulation game for the 3DS.

name: The Border Lands
description: The Border Lands is a 2D top-down browser version of the popular console game Borderlands 2. The game has cool 2D 16-bit graphics and authentic map locations to explore. Before starting, you can choose from 4 of the original characters from Borderlands 2 – Salvador, Maya, Zero or Axton - each character has unique abilities and differing skills.

name: Delver's Drop
description: A 2D action RPG from Pixelscopic.

name: Code Hero
description: Learn how to code by saving the world with a ray gun that shoots Javascript.

name: Digimon Adventure
description: The story retells the story of the 1999 anime series, in which seven children; Tai (Taichi), Matt (Yamato), Sora, Izzy (Koushiro), Mimi, Joe and T.K. (Takeru), are mysteriously transported to the Digital World, where they meet monster companions known as Digimon. Using the power of the Digivice to evolve their Digimon partners into more powerful forms, Tai, his friends and their Digimon companions must work together in order to save both the Digital World and their own. The game also features the story of the film, Our War Game!, as well as original scenarios exclusive to this game.

name: Crazy Strike Bowling
description: Bowling game released for PSN. It features an anime art style along with wacky bear shenanigans. This game requires the PlayStation Eye.

name: Battle High: Team-Up
description: Initial incarnation of the Battle High series with many differences - notably, the different stories for characters, as well as the lack of elemental powers. Now considered non-canon.

name: Ghost Mania
description: A block matching puzzle game.

name: Mystery Agency: Visions of Time
description: Sin descripción

name: Chill Manor
description: A FPS in the vein of Doom, crossed with a history lesson.

name: Golem no Maigo
description: A Dreamcast puzzler developed mostly by one Japanese student, Golem no Maigo (also known by its English translation "The Lost Golem") tasks you with guiding the king to the end of every stage by pushing walls around while also ensuring there are enough walls that remain intact to progress.

name: Alice's Tea Cup Madness
description: Time management game.

name: A Dwarf's Story
description: Mixture of hidden object and arcade game.

name: Enchanted Katya and the Mystery of the Lost Wizard
description: Time management game.

name: Starbeast
description: A 2.5D sidescrolling shooter for Wii U, PC and mobile platforms

name: AKB1/48: Idol to Guam to Koishitara...
description: AKB1/48 Idol to Guam to Koishitara... is the second entry in the AKB1/48 dating sim series where you are invited to Guam to spend time and date one of the 48 group members.

name: Super Mini Puzzle Heroes
description: Nickelodeon crossover puzzle game.

name: Women's Murder Club: A Darker Shade of Grey
description: Adventure/Hidden object game.

name: Women's Murder Club: Twice in a Blue Moon
description: Adventure/Hidden object game.

name: Go-Go Gourmet: Chef of the Year
description: Time management game.

name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Sewer Run
description:
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Sewer Run is a browser-based action game. The events take place directly after Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Dark Horizons.
The game consists of four levels that each have a racing section and a fighting section. The racing section has the Turtle selected race to catch up with the target before time runs out, while the fighting section has the Turtle defeat a selected number of Foot Soldiers by hitting back shuriken thrown at him.

name: Blood Oath
description: Hidden object game.

name: Go-Go Gourmet
description: Time management game.

name: Dr. Lynch: Grave Secrets
description: Hidden object game.

name: Nocturnal: Boston Nightfall
description: Hidden object game.

name: The Sultan's Labyrinth
description: A hidden object game. Long ago in ancient Persia, Sultan Bahar`s rule inspired the minds of his followers. Although, it was his fair and beautiful daughter, Princess Sadira, who captured their hearts. Can you help Sultan Bahar find a suitable prince for his royal daughter? Each prince must demonstrate his wisdom by solving puzzles within the Sultan`s Labyrinth. In a grueling Hidden Object-themed competition, who will defeat the Sultan`s Labyrinth?

name: Hidden Expedition: The Uncharted Islands
description: Hidden Expedition: The Uncharted Islands is a hidden object game and the fifth entry into the Hidden Expedition series of "seek and find" games. The gameplay is similar to previous instalments, with the focus being on finding items scattered across a diverse collection of scenes. Some items are placed in the player's inventory and need to be used in other locations to advance in the game. The game does feature some variations on the basic hidden object formula, with many hidden object scenes being two screens wide, and some items only being revealed by the manipulation of other items.

name: Sanatorium
description: Sanatorium is a horror-exploration game based on Slender.

name: Hidden Expedition: Devil's Triangle
description:
Hidden Expedition: Devil's Triangle is the fourth entry in the hidden object game series produced by Big Fish Games since 2006. As in most recent titles of the genre, the adventure elements are more pronounced with full inventory and puzzles complementing the simple hidden object scenes.

Like in most first-person point-and-click adventures, the player navigates through various locations by clicking on hotspots positioned over obvious exit openings, like doors and other places. The rooms are presented as a series of static screens with interactive portions. The cursor is context-sensitive, changing shape when hovering over an interactive part of the scenery. It morphs into an eye when over a place with a close-up view, that sometimes contains a hidden object scene or a mini-game. It transforms into golden arrows when over one of the exit hotspots. It becomes a hand when over a scenery object that can be collected. It displays swirling blue circles over special areas where an inventory item can be used.

name: Forgotten Lands: First Colony
description: Real-time strategy game.

name: Cassandra's Journey: The Legacy of Nostradamus
description: Cassandra's Journey: The Legacy of Nostradamus is a hidden object game that puts you in the role of Cassandra, a young mystic relying on a mysterious ring to solve cases that are assumed to be impossible. The game features animated cutscenes, mind-reading magic tricks, and fun for the whole family.

name: Forgotten Riddles: The Moonlight Sonatas
description: Hidden object game.

name: Mystery Chronicles: Murder Among Friends
description: Hidden object game.

name: Treasure Seekers: Visions of Gold
description: Treasure Seekers: Visions of Gold is a hidden object game released for PC and mobile platforms. It is the first installment of the Treasure Seeker series.

name: Master of Defense
description: 3D tower defense strategy game.

name: Megaplex Madness: Now Playing
description: Time management game.

name: Venice Mystery
description: Pair up and match colorful tiles to clear over 700 levels and solve an ancient mystery. Gather special power-ups that will help you on your travel through the city of Venice, one of Italy's most interesting cities. Can you find the thirteen lost paintings from the past that hide a well hidden secret and repair the old machine to save the historical city from its nemesis? Get an extra bonus by destroying as many tiles as possible in one rush and collect coins to buy extras. Use joker and other special power-ups, unlock certain hidden areas on the play field by unlocking pyramid cover stones and find all hidden keys on the play field to finish your round.

name: Alice Greenfingers 2
description: Sequel to Alice Greenfingers.

name: Fairies
description: Puzzle-solving game.

name: Atlantis
description: Sin descripción

name: Azada: Ancient Magic
description: Point-and click adventure and sequel to Azada.

name: Garden Golf
description: Miniature golf game.

name: Assassin's Creed: Project Legacy
description:
Assassin's Creed: Project Legacy was a Facebook game, which was first made available on 30 September 2010 with the "Italian Wars" memory set.

In it, players were recruits for Abstergo Industries' Project Legacy, who relived the genetic memories of other individuals through a machine known as the DDS (Data Dump Scanner). Presumably, the DDS was similar to an Animus, but could allow a person to relive the memory of someone who was not their ancestor.

In all, there were three memory sets available: "Italian Wars", "Rome" (released 15 November 2010) and "Holidays" (released 22 December 2010). The fourth memory set, Divine Science ("released" 4 July 2011), was made available outside of the DDS by Erudito, though the DDS interface still mentioned that the pack was "coming soon."

On 15 May 2013, Facebook removed the game because it no longer complied with their Terms of Service for Facebook applications, as it had not been updated recently. It is unknown if the game will return in the future.

name: Tower Dream
description: A property-developing board game with a surreal sense of humor. A sequel was released in 1998 for the PlayStation.

name: Shanghai
description: Shanghai is a tile-based game based on the ancient Chinese game of Mah-Jong.

name: Gussun Oyoyo
description: Sin descripción

name: Gussun Paradise
description: A spinoff of the somewhat reasonably prolific Gussun Oyoyo series, this Playstation title is a lighthearted platform-puzzler set in an enemy-infested amusement park. Gussun Paradise also has the distinction of being the only console entry of the series to garner an english release under the moniker of YoYo's Puzzle Park in PAL territories.

name: Silent Mobius
description: "Silent Mobius" (called "Silent Mobius Case: Titanic" on the PSX) was an adventure game developed by Gainax based off the manga and anime series of the same name.

name: NFL Football
description: An NFL football game for the Super Nintendo and Nintendo Game Boy developed by Konami. It is one of the earlier NFL games to use a dynamic camera that turns around to follows whichever side is playing offense.

name: Project Lodus
description: Project Lodus is an upcoming co-op action RPG that was funded through the use of Kickstarter.

name: Rain
description: Looks a bit damp out today. A story made for the Radio Silence #BitsyJam.

name: W Ring: The Double Rings
description: A Japanese PC Engine exclusive horizontal shoot 'em up. Power-ups appear as rings around the player's ship.

name: Gulclight TDF2
description: Gulclight TDF2 is a Japanese shoot 'em up.

name: IHF Handball Challenge 13
description: The follow-up to IHF Handball Challenge 12. It was quietly canceled so that work in IHF Handball Challenge 14 could begin.

name: Fruit Ninja: Puss in Boots
description: Movie tie-in Fruit Ninja game

name: Fruit Ninja Frenzy
description: Browser-based Fruit Ninja.

name: Epic Meal Time
description: Fruit Ninja-esque game based on the popular YouTube cooking show.

name: Block-Man 1
description:
The player controls Block-man. Block-Man is in a game-area bounded by red bricks and flaming torches, representing the room he's in. Every room has an exit and from his starting position Block-Man must get to that exit. In his way are walls and pits that he must overcome. The only available resource are building bricks. The only commands available are move left / right. pick up/put down and climb (a maximum of one brick only). Using these commands the player must solve the puzzle and get Block-Man to the exit of each room. 
 
The shareware game consists of ten levels. The full, registered, game has more levels, and for a further fee a constructor option that allows the player to create and play their own levels and those of other game owners is available.

name: Happy Lesson: First Lesson
description: Fan disc released with "Happy Slot" (slot machine), "Happy Gallery" (art gallery) and "Happy Net"

name: Aura Battler Dunbine: Seisenshi Densetsu
description: Dunbine is a strategy RPG based on the anime of the same name.

name: Tunnel Tail
description: Tunnel Tail is an RPG where players control the members of the Mouse Tribe as they struggle against the influence of the wicked Lumini.

name: Thunder Offshore
description: Thunder Offshore is a DOS based action game from Spain.

name: Gamebook Adventures 7: Temple of the Spider God
description: Gamebook Adventures 7: Temple of the Spider God is the seventh Gamebook Adventures game from Tin Man Games.

name: Gamebook Adventures 8: Infinite Universe
description: Gamebook Adventures 8: Infinite Universe is the eighth title in the Gamebook Adventures series.

name: Assassin's Creed: Memories
description: Assassin's Creed: Memories is a role-playing trading card game, developed exclusively for the iOS. The servers were closed on 13 March 2015.

name: Gamebook Adventures 6: The Wizard from Tarnath Tor
description: Gamebook Adventures 6: The Wizard from Tarnath Tor is the sixth Gamebook game from Tin Man Games.

name: Gamebook Adventures 5: Catacombs of the Undercity
description: Gamebook Adventures 5: Catacombs of the Undercity is the fifth game in the Gamebook series by Tin Man Games.

name: Gamebook Adventures 2: The Siege of the Necromancer
description: Gamebook Adventures 2: The Siege of the Necromancer is the second release in the Gamebook Adventures series.

name: Gamebook Adventures 4: Revenant Rising
description: Gamebook Adventures 4: Revenant Rising is the fourth in Tin Man Games interactive storybook series.
